title: Maximum position of a point on a line

content.question: A particle moves along the x-axis so that its acceleration at any time t is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>a</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>t</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>7</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@410C@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. If the initial velocity of the particle is 6, at what time t during the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>4</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EF7@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is the particle farthest to the right?

topic.text: 4.2: Straight-Line Motion - Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
